New Records: LeBron James and his son Bronny James made NBA history when they played together for the first time during the Los Angeles Lakers' preseason game against Phoenix, becoming the first father and son to play in any NBA game at the same time, let alone on the same team.
Key Match Events: Bronny entered the game as a substitute to begin the second quarter, joining his father on the court out of the timeout.
LeBron hit a 3-pointer moments later, and then got the ball to Bronny and set a screen for his son's 3-point attempt, but Bronny missed.
Pre-Game Insights: LeBron has spoken for years about his longtime dream of playing in the NBA with one of his sons, and the Lakers made it a reality when they grabbed Bronny with the 55th pick in the draft.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron was early in his second NBA season with the Cleveland Cavaliers when he and his high school sweetheart, Savannah Brinson, became parents for the first time in 2004.
